page.title: 09TYPICAL EGMANTON FARMS (1)
page.content: A typical mixed farm is Island Farm, Egmanton. This has been farmed for 95 years by the same family and supports six people. The total acreage is 177 acres and this is split up as follows:- wheat 83\ acres, barley 127\ acres, sugar beet 28 acres, silage and grazing 70 acres, wooded land 3 acres. The average size of a field is 20 acres. The livestock is semi-intensive and includes 150 beef cattle which are fed on silage, rolled barley and straw concentrates; 200 ewes which are fed on rolled barley, hay, grass and sheep pellets. Farm machinery includes 6 tractors, 3 ploughs, 1 combine harvester, 1 sprayer, 1 drill and 2 balers, 1 rectangular and 1 round.
